title: Sell Ardbeg Committee Releases
metaTitle: Sell Ardbeg Committee Releases | Supernova, Alligator, Dark Cove | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your rare Ardbeg Committee Releases. We buy Supernova, Alligator, Dark Cove, and vintage 1970s Ardbeg bottles.
heroSubhead: Buying Ardbeg Committee Releases (White Labels) and Single Casks.
introParagraph: Ardbeg Committee Releases are often bottled at higher strength and are far rarer than general releases. They are the target for serious peat collectors.
photoChecklist: Front label showing 'Committee Release' or ABV difference
conditionFactors: Label Type: Differentiating 'Committee Release' (often white label) vs 'General Release' (black/green label).
Fill Level: Lord of the Isles bottles can suffer from evaporation.
Box: Special packaging (e.g. Alligator box) must be present.
Seal: Check for cracks on older wax or foils.
pricingFactors: Committee Status: CR bottles trade 50-100% higher than the standard version.
Vintage: Lord of the Isles (25 year old blend of 70s stock) is a blue chip.
ABV: Committee releases are usually ~50%+, General Release is ~46%.
Rarity: Supernova SN2009 and original releases are top tier.

faqs.question: How do I tell if it is a Committee Release?
faqs.answer: It usually says 'For Discussion' or 'Committee Release' on the label and has a higher alcohol percentage.

faqs.question: Do you buy the new releases?
faqs.answer: Yes, we buy the new feis ile and Committee releases (e.g. Scorch, Drum) but values are lower than the classics.

faqs.question: What is Lord of the Isles?
faqs.answer: Ardbeg's prestige bottling from the early 2000s. It is extremely valuable.

faqs.question: Do you buy Ardbeg 17?
faqs.answer: Yes, Ardbeg 17 is a discontinued classic.

faqs.question: What about Grooves/Kelpie?
faqs.answer: We buy them, but they are volume traders rather than investment grade.
